title: Coronary artery bypass or disease and driving

details.description: You may need to tell DVLA If you've had a coronary artery bypass or disease - if you do, download the correct form to let them know
details.body:
You may need to tell DVLA If you’ve had a coronary artery bypass or disease.

You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.

Car or motorcycle licence

You don’t need to tell DVLA. You should stop driving for at least 1 month and only restart driving when your doctor tell you that you are safe to do so. For further information please download the leaflet ‘CLE1066’.

Download ‘CLE1066 - Car or motorcycle drivers with heart conditions’ (PDF, 176KB)

Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form VOCH1 and send it DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘VOCH1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 394KB)
